snippet: Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, who is accused of killing 13 people in 2009, said he believed he was defending the lives of Taliban leaders from American military personnel.
abstract: Nidal Malik Hasan, Army psychiatrist accused of killing 13 people, tells judge that he believed he was defending lives of Taliban leadership in Afghanistan from American military personnel when he went on shooting rampage at Fort Hood, Tex, in 2009; comments come one day after judge granted request to release court-appointed military lawyers so that he could represent himself.
lead_paragraph: Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, who is accused of killing 13 people in 2009, said he believed he was defending the lives of Taliban leaders from American military personnel.
